com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSGenerateWorkOrderUE


  • public interface YFSGenerateWorkOrderUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document generateWorkOrders(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YFSGenerateWorkOrderUE user exit interface contains a user exit method for the generateWorkOrder API.

    • Method Detail

      • generateWorkOrders

        org.w3c.dom.Document generateWorkOrders(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSGenerateWorkOrderUE user exit interface contains a user exit method for the generateWorkOrder API. This user exit provides you an option of externalizing the logic to generate work orders for an order. In order to define logic for generating work orders, this user exit needs to be implemented. The work orders generated by the internal logic, as well as the order lines which do not have a work order are passed as input to the user exit. If the user exit is implemented, the work orders returned by the user exit override the work orders created/modified by the internal logic. Also, each work order returned by the user exit should be identified by either the WorkOrderKey or the combination of WorkOrderNo, ShipNodeKey and EnterpriseCode, to be able to uniquely identify the work order. Every work order returned by the user exit will be read and if the flag CreatedOrModified is set to Created or Modified then, depending on whether the work order is a new one or not, either createWorkOrder API or modifyWorkOrder API will be called.

        Note:

        1. The work orders returned by the user exit are not validated before calling createWorkOrder or modifyWorkOrder, as the case may be. Hence, if the status of the work order does not allow it's modification, modifyWorkOrder API will throw an exception. If the check for modification of the work order needs to be overridden, the flag OverrideModificationRules can be used. Refer to the output of the user exit for more details on this flag.
        2. Depending on the output of the user exit, there may be new delivery service lines as well as new product-service associations added to the order. However, the user exit cannot be used to make any other changes to the order like adding a new product line or a new provided service line. Attempt to do so will result in an error.

        The input to this user exit is template controlled.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: The user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should be a valid XML.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input files.


        Returns:
        A Valid XML. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
